repository.corpname: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

did.unittitle: Mount Vernon Seminary and College Office of Student Activities records
did.abstract: This collection contains records of the Office of Student Activities at Mount Vernon Seminary and College. The Mount Vernon Seminary began in 1875 as a private high school and junior college for women, founded by Elizabeth J. Somers. The George Washington University initially affiliated with Mount Vernon College and ultimately acquired the college's property and legacy in 1999. The materials date from 1988â€“1998, with the bulk of the collection ranging from 1996-1998.This collection contains photographs, Betacam SP tapes, receipts, correspondence, brochures, and documents on numerous events, programs, and student clubs at Mount Vernon Seminary and College including Commencement, Family Weekend, and Winter Formal. The materials date from 1988-1998, with the bulk of the collection ranging from 1996-1998. The records are related to the Office of Student Activities and its role in the organization and participation of students in various activities and ceremonies held by Mount Vernon College.
did.physloc: Materials may be stored off-site, and may require additional retrieval time. Please contact the Special Collections Research Center for more information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains photographs, Betacam SP tapes, receipts, correspondence, brochures, and documents on numerous events, programs, and student clubs at Mount Vernon Seminary and College including Commencement, Family Weekend, and Winter Formal. The materials date from 1988-1998, with the bulk of the collection ranging from 1996-1998. The records are related to the Office of Student Activities and its role in the organization and participation of students in various activities and ceremonies held by Mount Vernon College.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Office of Student Activities at Mount Vernon College was responsible for student clubs and planning events and ceremonies on campus.

The Mount Vernon Seminary began in 1875 as a private high school and junior college for women, founded by Elizabeth J. Somers. The George Washington University initially affiliated with Mount Vernon College, and ultimately acquired the college's property and legacy in 1999.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized by category chronologically.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please cite unpublished materials in the following way:
Please provide the title and date of item, catalog number (if applicable it will be found written on the folder), name of the collection, name of the repository, and location of the repository.

Example: James Oglethorpe to the Trustees, 13 January 1876, RG0001 Series 1, Box 4, Folder 3. Records of the Board of Trustees, Special Collections Research Center, Gelman Library, The George Washington University, Washington, D.C.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This collection is from Mount Vernon College, which George Washington University acquired in 1999.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains photographs from events on campus.
